name: Total Installed Price (Barbose & Darghouth (2016))
datasetName: Solar PV Systems Costs - Barbose & Darghouth (2016)

source.name: Solar PV Systems Costs - Barbose & Darghouth (2016)
source.dataPublishedBy: Barbose & Darghouth (2016). Tracking the Sun IX: The Installed Price of Residential and Non-Residential Photovoltaic Systems in the United States
source.dataPublisherSource: State agencies, utilities, and other organizations that administer PV incentive programs, solar renewable energy credit (SREC) registration systems, and interconnection processes.
source.additionalInfo:
Data is based on median residential solar photovolatic (PV) prices in the United States only.

Installed non-module prices include hardware costs, such as inverters and racking equipment; and the wide assortment of soft costs, including such things as marketing and customer acquisition, system design, installation labor, permitting and inspection costs, and installer margins.

Non-module costs have been assumed to be the total solar PV system price minus the solar module price.
